p: Adrenoyl-EA is structurally similar to the major endocannabinoid anandamide and functions as an agonist of the CB 1 and TRPV 1 receptor proteins, two major receptors of the human ECS [ 21, 24]. Agonists of these receptors are ideal candidates in a range of therapeutic targets, specifically exhibiting anti-inflammatory, neuroprotective, and anticancer activities, among others [ 23, 25, 26]. Within the growing market of TMs, we consider it beneficial to identify sustainable, climate resilient plant resources (high yielding medicinal crops) that accumulate pCBs or PCB-like compounds with the potential for therapeutic purposes.
